description: From Middle English lefsum, leofsum, probably from Old English *lēofsum, equivalent to lief +‎ -some. Compare Old High German liobsam (“liefsome”), German liebsam.

adjectives.description: liefsome (comparative more liefsome, superlative most liefsome)

entries.meaning: (dialectal, poetic or archaic) Agreeable; pleasing; delightful.
examples: The manner in which he treated my dog did not seem very liefsome to me.
